text: Hi, this is Alex from MinuteEarth.
By weight, this young tree is about half carbon.

And like all trees, it literally pulls its
carbon out of thin air.

As it grows, it’ll extract as much carbon
from the atmosphere as there is in an entire
stadiums-worth of air.
Which is great!

Because as you’ve probably heard, one of
the top items on humanity’s to-do list is
to pull carbon out of the air.

Not ALL of it - our collective task is to
remove 1/7th of the carbon.

That’s as much carbon as there is in a trillion
stadiums-worth of air.

And the crazy thing is that trees can do this
entire job for us.
But we’ll need to plant a trillion of them.

Plus, we’re currently putting an additional
trillion stadiums-worth of carbon into the

air every decade, and we don’t have enough
space for an additional trillion trees every
decade, so new trees alone won’t cut it.

In addition to planting new trees, we’ll
also need to develop new energy sources, switch

to more sustainable foods, and protect the
trees we currently have.

Doing all of this will take a tree-mendous
effort, but if we don’t want to be his-tree,
we need to leaf it all on the field.
That’s why we’ve joined TeamTrees.org.

TeamTrees is made up of a bunch of YouTubers
that have come together with the goal of planting
20 million trees by 2020.

Now, 20 million is both a ton of trees, and
at the same time just a fraction of the trillion

trees we need to plant, but we’ve got to
start somewhere.

And if even half the subscribers to the YouTube
channels participating in TeamTrees contributed

even a little, we’d crush the goal and send
a message to politicians that it’s time
to get serious about climate change.

We’re going to donate the ad revenue from
this video to TeamTrees, and we'd love for
you to join the team too.

For every dollar you donate, our partner - the
Arbor Day Foundation - will plant one tree.

So go to TeamTrees.org, or click on the “donate”
button below.
Let’s get planting!
